title: Sales Manager, Amazon
content:
Job Description
 




Job Title:


Sales Manager, Amazon




Department:


Sales




Company:


Fender EMEA




Location:


Hybrid (East Grinstead, London)




Responsible to:


SVP, Managing Director Europe




Responsible for:


Amazon Europe Account Management




Key Purpose of the Job
 
The Amazon Sales Manager role is an important member of EMEA Sales team. The role will manage the Amazon Account collaborating with various cross functional teams within the company. 
 
Your key objectives include step changing Amazon sales performance, ensuring effective product, promotional, content and AMS strategies. You'll also handle JBP negotiations for this account and related 3rd party services, and line manage the existing Amazon team. This role offers opportunities to work with diverse teams in the UK and globally, providing insights into Fenderâ€™s broader operations.
Main Responsibilities

Own and develop the relationship between Amazon Europe and the internal Fender teams.
Achieve or exceed budgeted sales target and objective performance goals for Amazon, whilst also acting in the best interest of the business in partnership with Amazon and related 3rd parties/agencies.
Develop and execute growth and development strategies with Amazon that align with the global organisational strategy and representation of the brand.  This includes creation and execution of Joint Business Plans with Amazon. 
Support the creation of promotional and AMS plans with Amazon managing and controlling investments through rigorous analysis and tracking tools to ensure strong ROI delivery.
Drive continuous improvement across the Amazon platform and internal practices to support continued high levels of performance.
Establish and maintain positive working relationships with all areas of FMIC and the Amazon internal matrix.
Collaboration with Demand Planning, Logistics, Customer Service, Product Management and Amazon AVS contacts to help maximize execution and enhance product availability, traffic and conversion.

 

Oversee detailed analysis of sales and inventory data to improve forecasting and planning procedures.
Develop and monitor KPI for product lines and account management.
Maintain a high level of product knowledge for the relevant product lines being sold through Amazon.
Demonstrate the ability to present the plan to the wider business at all times, proactively search out input from internal key stakeholders and use this to information to expand the plan further.
Line management of at least 2 FTEs within the Amazon Business Development team.

Additional strength areas

Manage the careers and day to day planning of a team with varying levels of experience and ability.
Represent the Company in a positive manner at all times.
Work with FP&A and Planning to ensure budgeting and forecasting is accurate.
Provide a channel strategy on new product releases.
Liaise with European Marketing & Product Departments on new releases and proposed projects.

 
This is an indication of the responsibilities of the role and the Company reserve the right to amend the content of the role at its discretion.  You will be required to work outside of your job description and be comfortable to take ownership of whatever reasonably comes your way.
Person Specification
Essential Skills/Experience
 

Amazon Account experience or expertise in managing complex accounts at a high level, as well as direct line management experience.
We are seeking a candidate with a minimum of 5-8 years of National Account Manager experience.
Excellent leadership skills with demonstrated competencies and experience in this area.
Ability to work through and support others through a change management programme.
Ability to influence and assimilate information quickly.
Proof of strong judgement, drive and influence.
Strong understanding of motivational tools and how to use them.
Strategic decision maker with ability to use data to understand trends and identify opportunities.
Entrepreneurial spirit with the ability to pivot and problem solve.
Impeccable business acumen.
Good understanding of P&L, deliver monthly and annual business targets as well as judgement and insights to assess and build new business models.
Results driven, and able to reach and exceed personal targets.
Expert in the use of Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook, with demonstrable experience of using diverse company specific systems and software. 
Ability to work on own initiative and be self-motivated. 
First class communication skills, both written and verbal.
Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information. 
Ability to organise and prioritise work, adapting to changing priorities where appropriate.
Ability to problem solve and contingency plan.

Key Working Relationships
Internal
SVP, Managing Director
Internal Amazon Business Development Team
All Functional Support Departments 
External
Amazon Account Management
3rd Party Agencies

If Referral or Other please specify:
Do you play a musical instrument? If yes, what instrument do you play?

PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING STATEMENTS CAREFULLY: The information I've provided on this application is accurate to the best of my knowledge and subject to verification. Any misrepresentation or deliberate omission of fact in my application will be justification for refusal to employ me or for termination of my employment by Fender Musical Instruments Corporation. If employed, I shall sign the non-compete/confidentiality agreement, if applicable, in which I will agree to protect Fender Musical Instruments Corporation's confidential information. If employed, I understand that Fender Musical Instruments Corporation is an "at will" employer, in that employment is terminable at the will of the company or me at any time, with or without notice, and for any lawful reason, or no reason. I understand that, if employed, I must at all times comply with Fender Musical Instruments Corporation's standards of work performance and business conduct. Failure to do so can result in my release without notice or severance pay. I authorize Fender Musical Instruments Corporation to obtain information about me from my previous employers and schools.
